Class Maze

java.lang.Object
  Maze
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMaze
public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMaze

This class represents a 2D maze. It takes a ".txt." file when an instance of the class is instantiated and converts it into a 2D array which then defines the maze. It also contains methods that return information concerning the maze.

Author:
Yifan Ge, Kevin Thomas, Davis Gallinghouse

Constructor Detail

Maze

public Maze(java.lang.String fileName)
     throws java.io.IOException
Constructs a maze object by reading information from a File object. It uses the Scanner class to read the file and stores the information in the instant fields. The algorithm is using scanner to store lines to an ArrayList and then uses charAt() method in String class to store each character to the 2-D character array. MazePanel calls this method.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

isExit

public boolean isExit(int x,
                      int y)
Determines whether the provided coordinates are an exit in the maze or not. The x coordinate determines the column (starting at 0 on the left), while the y coordinate determines the row (starting at 0 on the top).

Called by MazePanel methods

Specified by:
isExit in interface IMaze
Parameters:
x - the column
y - the row
Returns:
whether the coordinates indicate a maze exit

visited

public int visited(int x,
                   int y)

Parameters:

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Converts the maze object to a string. The wall is represented by asterisks(*). "X" and "S" represent the exit and starting point, respectively.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
the string that represents the maze object
